title: Marcus Jones explains motivation, process that led to new contract with Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots “I signed for a reason.
I trust what [Vrabel] brings to the table.
" Marcus Jones signed a new contract extension on Tuesday.

title: Death of man who died in standoff with Fall River police ruled a suicide, DA says
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The Office of the Chief Medical Examiner, who performed the man’s autopsy, indicated that his fatal gunshot wound was self-inflicted.
By Darin Zullo October 29, 2025 | 6:51 PM 1 minute to read The death of a man who died in an armed standoff with Fall River police in July has been ruled a suicide, according to prosecutors.

Domonick Knight, 38, of Fall River, suffered a gunshot wound to the head and was later pronounced dead after exchanging gunfire with police in the early hours of July 15, the Bristol County District Attorney’s office said in a statement Wednesday.

title: Duxbury mother Lindsay Clancy asks for another delay in murder trial
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Clancy is scheduled to stand trial in February for allegedly killing her three young children.
Lindsay Clancy appeared via Zoom from Tewksbury Hospital for a hearing last month in Plymouth Superior Court in Brockton.
Clancy has pleaded not guilty to three counts of murder for the slayings of her three young children.

title: Hampus Lindholm’s return bodes well for Bruins beleaguered D corps
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins “He calmed everything down.
He made some good plays, good reads.
" Hampus Lindholm had missed eight of Boston's last nine games.

title: Tewksbury woman charged in profanity-riddled clash at local Market Basket
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Kristin Hartman allegedly pushed one grocery store employee and hit another with a shopping cart.

Zack Wittman for the Boston Globe, File By Abby Patkin October 29, 2025 | 3:41 PM 1 minute to read A Tewksbury woman allegedly pushed one Market Basket employee and hit another with a shopping cart during a profanity-riddled fracas at a local grocery store Tuesday, according to police.

Kristin Hartman, 54, is facing charges of disorderly conduct, assault and battery with a dangerous weapon (shod foot), vandalism, assault and battery, assault and battery with a dangerous weapon (shopping cart), driving under the influence of liquor, resisting arrest, and two counts of assault and battery on a police officer.

title: Former South Shore teacher charged with sexually assaulting students pleads guilty
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Jeffrey Knight changed his plea one day before he was due to stand trial.

By Abby Patkin October 29, 2025 | 3:37 PM 2 minutes to read A former Cohasset Middle School teacher was sentenced to two-and-a-half years in prison Monday after pleading guilty to sexually assaulting two former students.
Jeffrey Knight changed his plea one day before he was due to stand trial, court records show.
